    • Method Detail

      • isNetworkAvailable

        public static boolean isNetworkAvailable()
        This method checks the Internet connectivity across the application.

        Creates a HttpURLConnection and opens a communications link to the resource referenced by this URL. If the connection is established successfully, this method will return true which indicates Internet Access available, otherwise, it will return false, indicating Internet Access not available.

        Returns:
        true, if is network available and false, if it is not available.

      • checkServiceAvailability

        public static boolean checkServiceAvailability(String serviceUrl)
        This method checks the service availability.

        Creates a HttpURLConnection and opens a communications link to the resource referenced by this URL. If the connection is established successfully, this method will return true which indicates Internet Access available, otherwise, it will return false, indicating Internet Access not available.

        Parameters:
        serviceUrl - the service url which is required to open the communications link.
        Returns:
        true, if connection is available and false, if it is not available.

      • isDiskSpaceAvailable

        public static boolean isDiskSpaceAvailable()
        This method checks for the Disk Space Availability.

        Gets the FileSystem of the OperatingSystem that is currently used. Gets all the OSFileStore from the fileSystem and takes the FileStore that matches the current directory and then checks whether the usable space of the fileStore is greater than required disk space threshold. If it is greater, then it indicates that the required disk space is available, else, the required space is not available.

        Returns:
        true, if is disk space available and false, if space is not available.

      • acceptAnySSLCerticficate

        public static void acceptAnySSLCerticficate()
                                     throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                            KeyManagementException
        This method is used to accept any SSL certificate.

        Installs the all-trusting TrustManager by creating a null implementation which is treated as a successful validation and removing all other implementations.

        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - the no such algorithm exception
        KeyManagementException - the key management exception

      • isWindows

        public static boolean isWindows()
        This method checks if the Operating System is windows.
        Returns:
        true, if the OS is windows

      • isLinux

        public static boolean isLinux()
        This method checks if the Operating System is Linux.
        Returns:
        true, if the OS is Linux
